info.title: Akoya Notifications API v1.0.2
info.description:
v1.0.2 update
- Updated sandbox test event endpoint
v1.0.1 update
- Added sandbox API server
- Added sandbox test event endpoint

Event notifications.

To use this API, first subscribe to the category and types of notifications you'd like to receive. Each subscription has an identification number so that you may maintain your subscriptions.

post.description:
Creates a notification subscription.
> ðŸ“˜ Note
>
> This endpoint is supported in sandbox (`https://sandbox-api.akoya.com`) and production (`https://api.akoya.com`)

> ðŸ›‘ The *service token* should be used as the bearer token with this call.

*Coming soon!
Akoya will be requiring MTLS authentication for your callbackURL. This will enhance security for your end-users.*

patch.description:
Update the `callbackUrl`, `effectiveDate`, or `callbackEmail` of a notification subscription.

> ðŸ“˜ Note
>
> This endpoint is supported in sandbox (`https://sandbox-api.akoya.com`) and production (`https://api.akoya.com`)

> ðŸ›‘ The *service token* should be used as the bearer token with this call.

callbackUrl.description: Callback URL. Previous callback URL will be updated with latest.

callbackEmail.description: Optional. Captured for future implementation, which will be in an upcoming release.

Example 1.title: Akoya Support - Maintenance Outage
Example 1.message: There's unplanned maintenance scheduled with mikomo for an API you have access to. Mikomo will be performing maintenance on PAYMENTS API in the production environment. The following APIs will be impacted: Payments; Given the nature of this impact, services may unavailable while the maintenance is occurring. Please contact us if you have any questions about this maintenance. To report a production issue with your API integration, log into the Akoya Support Portal to submit a support ticket.

value.title: Akoya Support - Maintenance Outage
value.message: There's unplanned maintenance scheduled with mikomo for an API you have access to. Mikomo will be performing maintenance on PAYMENTS API in the production environment. The following APIs will be impacted: Payments; Given the nature of this impact, services may unavailable while the maintenance is occurring. Please contact us if you have any questions about this maintenance. To report a production issue with your API integration, log into the Akoya Support Portal to submit a support ticket.

get.description:
The maintenance notification details that inform you on impacted service and when it will be resolved.
The notification payload id is required for this call. This id is returned in the notification sent to your webhook.

> ðŸ“˜ Note
>
> This endpoint is supported in sandbox (`https://sandbox-api.akoya.com`) and production (`https://api.akoya.com`)

> ðŸ›‘ The *service token* should be used as the bearer token with this call.

post.description:
Validate that your server can handle incoming webhook payloads from Akoya.

> ðŸ“˜ Note
>
> This endpoint is only supported in sandbox (`https://sandbox-api.akoya.com`)

id.description: A valid sandbox notification subscription ID. The triggered test event will be pushed to the callback URL associated with this subscription.

notification.title: Notification entity
notification.description: Provides the base fields of a notification. Clients will read the `type` property to determine the expected notification payload

notificationPayload.title: Notification Payload entity
notificationPayload.description: Custom key-value pairs payload for a notification

id.description: ID for the origination entity related to the notification

idType.description: Type of entity causing origination of the notification with the given ID

customFields.description: Custom key-value pairs for a notification

notificationSubscription.title: Notification Subscription entity
notificationSubscription.description: Provides the fields of a notification subscription

callbackUrl.description: The URL to receive webhooks from Akoya. Must be HTTPS.

callbackEmail.description: Optional. Captured for future implementation, which will be in an upcoming release.

error.title: Error
error.description: An error entity which can be used at the API level for error responses or at the account level to indicate a problem specific to a particular account

code.description: Long term persistent identifier which can be used to trace error condition back to log information

message.description: End user displayable information which might help the customer diagnose an error

debugMessage.description: Message used to debug the root cause of the error. Contents should not be used in consumer's business logic. Can change at any time and should only be used for consumer to communicate with the data provider about an issue. Provider can include an error GUID in message for their use.

hateoasLink.title: HATEOAS Link
hateoasLink.description: REST application constraint (Hypermedia As The Engine Of Application State)

href.description: URL to invoke the action on the resource

action.description: HTTP Method to use for the request

rel.description: Relation of this link to its containing entity, as defined by and with many example relation values at [IETF RFC5988](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc5988)

500.description: Catch all exception where request was not processed due to an internal outage/issue. Consider other more specific errors before using this error

value.debugMessage: Provider custom developer-level error details for troubleshooting

501.description: Error when FdxVersion in Header is not one of those implemented at backend

value.message: FdxVersion not supported or not implemented
value.debugMessage: Provider custom developer-level error details for troubleshooting

bearerAuth.description: Your service token should be used in the header of this call.
